comments:
Build ID: M20071023-1652

Steps To Reproduce:
Start eclipse with option -clean


More information:
I started eclipse using the option -clean after having added the db40 plug-in. The main screen appeard but I could not acces any menus etc. it was unresponsive. If I obscured eclipse shortly with another window, i would not refresh the screen.

I then launched jconsole and connected to eclipse. This worked. I tried the "Detect Deadlock" button and it reported me a deadlock between main and Worker-1 with theses statck traces:

I stopped and restarted eclipse and it hung again. This time I noticed it said "Initialize Java Tooling 0%" in the lower right corner of the main window.

I stopped and restarted a third time because I was unsure if it was Java or JDT Tooling, and this time eclipse works.
From the trace, it seems like this might be a Mylyn problem. Which package are you using? Eclipse Classic or the Eclipse IDE for Java Developers?

As far as I remember I installed originally the Classic and later added other stuff via Europe discovery site, plus subversion, eclipseME and lastly android plugin.

(In reply to comment #0)
> I started eclipse using the option -clean after having added the db40 plug-in.
(In reply to comment #2)
> As far as I remember I installed originally the Classic and later added other
> stuff via Europe discovery site, plus subversion, eclipseME and lastly android
> plugin.

That's a hell of a lot of plug-ins you have there. Anyway, your two comments conflict each other, did you install db4o last or did you install Android last?

I still think this is a Mylyn problem though. If I look in my own workspace logs, I also see a ton of things that are logged by Mylyn.

org.osgi.framework.BundleException: State change in progress for bundle "update@plugins/org.eclipse.mylyn.context.ui_2.2.0.I20071024-2200.jar" by thread "Worker-3".
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.beginStateChange(AbstractBundle.java:1138)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.start(AbstractBundle.java:259)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.util.SecureAction.start(SecureAction.java:400)
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseLazyStarter.postFindLocalClass(EclipseLazyStarter.java:111)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.baseadaptor.loader.ClasspathManager.findLocalClass(ClasspathManager.java:419)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.DefaultClassLoader.findLocalClass(DefaultClassLoader.java:189)

        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.loadClass(BundleLoader.java:289)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleHost.loadClass(BundleHost.java:227)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.loadClass(AbstractBundle.java:1266)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.osgi.RegistryStrategyOSGI.createExecutableExtension(RegistryStrategyOSGI.java:160)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ExtensionRegistry.createExecutableExtension(ExtensionRegistry.java:819)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElement.createExecutableExtension(ConfigurationElement.java:243)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElementHandle.createExecutableExtension(ConfigurationElementHandle.java:51)
        at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.tasks.ui.util.TasksUiExtensionReader.readDynamicPopupContributor(TasksUiExtensionReader.java:421)
        at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.tasks.ui.util.TasksUiExtensionReader.initStartupExtensions(TasksUiExtensionReader.java:159)

Note that mine is also caused by TaskUiExtensionReader's initStartupExtensions method.

Moving to Mylyn as it indeed seems involved in the deadlock per se.
The Java initialization blocked at 0% rather sounds like a consequence, not a root cause.
We have recently make significant changes to the Mylyn startup sequence (bug 188524). Remy, could you verify with the latest weekly build if you are still seeing these errors?

Created an attachment (id=83113)
My workspace log file after installing I20071113-0800.

(In reply to comment #5)
> We have recently make significant changes to the Mylyn startup sequence (bug
> 188524). Remy, could you verify with the latest weekly build if you are still
> seeing these errors?

Steffen, my steps as follows:
1. Downloaded I20071113-0800. Started it on a random workspace (that exists but I don't do anything in it, it has no projects).
2. Used Update Manager to install Mylyn via the download.eclipse.org/tools/mylyn/update/weekly/e3.4 site.
3. Prompt to shutdown, choose no.
4. Manually shutdown.
5. Restart with -clean pointing it at my Mylyn-enabled workspace (I have multiple workspaces, only one of which I use a Mylyn-enabled Eclipse on). That workspace had its .log file removed prior to said launch.
6. Check my logs, see attached.

The extension problem seems to be gone but there's still another problem, as you can see.

Thanks for verifying and posting the stack trace Remy. The dependency on ITaskHighlighter was fixed two days ago but didn't make it into this week's build. The fix will become available with the next Wednesday's build. It would be great if you could update then and comment in case the error persists.

(In reply to comment #7)
> Thanks for verifying and posting the stack trace Remy. The dependency on
> ITaskHighlighter was fixed two days ago but didn't make it into this week's
> build. The fix will become available with the next Wednesday's build. It would
> be great if you could update then and comment in case the error persists.

Steffen, that shouldn't be a problem. Please ping me here when the build has completed and is available through the update manager next week. I will try again then.

In reply to comment #3:
